snippet: Investigators are beginning the task of unraveling how a routine afternoon of cutting fire lines along the edge of a community in Arizona became the deadliest day for wilderness firefighters in 80 years.
abstract: Investigators are beginning task of unraveling how a routine afternoon of cutting fire lines along Arizona community's edge became deadliest day for wilderness fighters in 80 years, killing team of 19; fires in region have become more frequent and more dangerous, straining men on front line and logistical infrastructure that stands behind them.

byline.original: By FERNANDA SANTOS and JACK HEALY
byline.contributor: Dan Frosch and Ian Lovett contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Investigators are beginning the task of unraveling how a routine afternoon of cutting fire lines along the edge of a community in Arizona became the deadliest day for wilderness firefighters in 80 years.

headline.main: A Painful Mix of Fire, Wind and Questions
headline.print_headline: A Painful Mix Of Fire, Wind And Questions
